content:
TITLE: Configuring Environment Variables for Xyne
DESCRIPTION: Sample environment variables configuration in .env.default file that needs to be customized with user-specific credentials for Google authentication, encryption keys, AI provider API keys, and other essential settings.
SOURCE: https://github.com/xynehq/xyne/blob/main/docs/quickstart.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
ENCRYPTION_KEY=<YOUR_ENCRYPTION_KEY>
SERVICE_ACCOUNT_ENCRYPTION_KEY=<YOUR_SERVICE_ACCOUNT_ENCRYPTION_KEY> 
  

GOOGLE_CLIENT_ID=<YOUR_GOOGLE_CLIENT_ID>
GOOGLE_CLIENT_SECRET=<YOUR_GOOGLE_CLIENT_SECRET>
GOOGLE_REDIRECT_URI=http://localhost:3000/v1/auth/callback
GOOGLE_PROD_REDIRECT_URI=http://localhost:3001/v1/auth/callback


JWT_SECRET=<YOUR_JWT_SECRET>


DATABASE_HOST=xyne-db
VESPA_HOST=vespa

## If using AWS Bedrock
AWS_ACCESS_KEY=<YOUR_AWS_ACCESS_KEY>
AWS_SECRET_KEY=<YOUR_AWS_ACCESS_SECRET>
AWS_REGION=<YOUR_AWS_REGION>
  
## OR [ If using Open AI ]
OPENAI_API_KEY=<YOUR_OPEN_API_KEY>

## OR [ If using Ollama ] 
OLLAMA_MODEL=<YOUR_OLLAMA_MODEL_NAME> 

## OR  [ If using Together AI ] 
TOGETHER_API_KEY=<YOUR_TOGETHER_API_KEY>
TOGETHER_MODEL=<YOUR_TOGETHER_MODEL>
TOGETHER_FAST_MODEL=<YOUR_TOGETHER_FAST_MODEL>

## OR  [ If using Fireworks AI ] 
FIREWORKS_API_KEY=<YOUR_FIREWORKS_API_KEY>
FIREWORKS_MODEL=<YOUR_FIREWORKS_MODEL>
FIREWORKS_FAST_MODEL=<YOUR_FIREWORKS_FAST_MODEL>

## OR [If using Google AI]
GEMINI_API_KEY=<YOUR_GEMINI_API_KEY> 
GEMINI_MODEL=<YOUR_GEMINI_MODEL_NAME>  

## If you are using custom OpenAI or Together AI endpoints
BASE_URL=<YOUR_BASE_URL>

HOST=http://localhost:3001
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: AI Provider Precedence in Xyne
DESCRIPTION: Shows the order in which Xyne selects AI providers when multiple keys are configured in the environment variables.
SOURCE: https://github.com/xynehq/xyne/blob/main/docs/apikeys/apikeys.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_11

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
AWS → OpenAI → Ollama → Together AI → Fireworks AI → Gemini
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Together AI with Reasoning in Xyne
DESCRIPTION: Complete setup for Together AI with reasoning capabilities, specifying models and enabling the reasoning feature for the main model only.
SOURCE: https://github.com/xynehq/xyne/blob/main/docs/apikeys/apikeys.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
TOGETHER_API_KEY=<YOUR_TOGETHER_API_KEY>
TOGETHER_MODEL=deepseek-ai/DeepSeek-R1
TOGETHER_FAST_MODEL=deepseek-ai/DeepSeek-V3
REASONING=true
FAST_MODEL_REASONING=false
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Fireworks AI with Reasoning in Xyne
DESCRIPTION: Complete setup for Fireworks AI with reasoning capabilities, specifying models and enabling the reasoning feature for the main model only.
SOURCE: https://github.com/xynehq/xyne/blob/main/docs/apikeys/apikeys.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
FIREWORKS_API_KEY=<YOUR_FIREWORKS_API_KEY>
FIREWORKS_MODEL=accounts/fireworks/models/deepseek-r1
FIREWORKS_FAST_MODEL=accounts/fireworks/models/deepseek-v3
REASONING=true
FAST_MODEL_REASONING=false
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Ollama with Reasoning in Xyne
DESCRIPTION: Complete setup for Ollama with reasoning capabilities, specifying models and enabling the reasoning feature for the main model only.
SOURCE: https://github.com/xynehq/xyne/blob/main/docs/apikeys/apikeys.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
OLLAMA_MODEL=<REASONING_MODEL>
OLLAMA_FAST_MODEL=non reasoning model
REASONING=true
FAST_MODEL_REASONING=false
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting up Google AI (Gemini) in Xyne
DESCRIPTION: Configures the Gemini API key and model name in the .env.default file for using Google AI capabilities.
SOURCE: https://github.com/xynehq/xyne/blob/main/docs/apikeys/apikeys.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
GEMINI_API_KEY=<YOUR_GEMINI_API_KEY> 
GEMINI_MODEL=<YOUR_GEMINI_MODEL_NAME>  
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting up Fireworks AI in Xyne
DESCRIPTION: Configures the Fireworks AI API key along with standard and fast model names in the .env.default file.
SOURCE: https://github.com/xynehq/xyne/blob/main/docs/apikeys/apikeys.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
FIREWORKS_API_KEY=<YOUR_FIREWORKS_API_KEY>
FIREWORKS_MODEL=<YOUR_FIREWORKS_MODEL>
FIREWORKS_FAST_MODEL=<YOUR_FIREWORKS_FAST_MODEL>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting up OpenAI API Key in Xyne
DESCRIPTION: Adds the OpenAI API key to the .env.default file for accessing OpenAI's models.
SOURCE: https://github.com/xynehq/xyne/blob/main/docs/apikeys/apikeys.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
OPENAI_API_KEY=<YOUR_OPENAI_API_KEY> 
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Environment Variables for Xyne Server
DESCRIPTION: Sample environment variables configuration in .env.default file with placeholders for API keys, encryption keys, and authentication credentials needed for Xyne deployment.
SOURCE: https://github.com/xynehq/xyne/blob/main/docs/deployment/cloud/aws/aws-deployment-with-docker.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
ENCRYPTION_KEY=<YOUR_ENCRYPTION_KEY>
SERVICE_ACCOUNT_ENCRYPTION_KEY=<YOUR_SERVICE_ACCOUNT_ENCRYPTION_KEY> 

  
GOOGLE_CLIENT_ID=<YOUR_GOOGLE_CLIENT_ID>
GOOGLE_CLIENT_SECRET=<YOUR_GOOGLE_CLIENT_SECRET>
GOOGLE_REDIRECT_URI=http://localhost:3001/v1/auth/callback
GOOGLE_PROD_REDIRECT_URI=<YOUR_Public_IPv4_DNS_ADDRESS>/v1/auth/callback

JWT_SECRET=<YOUR_JWT_SECRET>


DATABASE_HOST=xyne-db
VESPA_HOST=vespa


## If using AWS Bedrock
AWS_ACCESS_KEY=<YOUR_AWS_ACCESS_KEY>
AWS_SECRET_KEY=<YOUR_AWS_ACCESS_SECRET>
AWS_REGION=<YOUR_AWS_REGION>
  
## OR [ If using Open AI ]
OPENAI_API_KEY=<YOUR_OPEN_API_KEY>

## OR [ If using Ollama ] 
OLLAMA_MODEL=<YOUR_OLLAMA_MODEL_NAME> 

## OR  [ If using Together AI ] 
TOGETHER_API_KEY=<YOUR_TOGETHER_API_KEY>
TOGETHER_MODEL=<YOUR_TOGETHER_MODEL>
TOGETHER_FAST_MODEL=<YOUR_TOGETHER_FAST_MODEL>

## OR  [ If using Fireworks AI ] 
FIREWORKS_API_KEY=<YOUR_FIREWORKS_API_KEY>
FIREWORKS_MODEL=<YOUR_FIREWORKS_MODEL>
FIREWORKS_FAST_MODEL=<YOUR_FIREWORKS_FAST_MODEL>

## OR [If using Google AI]
GEMINI_API_KEY=<YOUR_GEMINI_API_KEY> 
GEMINI_MODEL=<YOUR_GEMINI_MODEL_NAME>  

## If you are using custom OpenAI or Together AI endpoints
BASE_URL=<YOUR_BASE_URL>
HOST=<YOUR_Public_IPv4_DNS_ADDRESS>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Custom Base URL for OpenAI or Together AI in Xyne
DESCRIPTION: Configures a custom base URL along with the API key for either OpenAI or Together AI, allowing for alternative API endpoints.
SOURCE: https://github.com/xynehq/xyne/blob/main/docs/apikeys/apikeys.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_10

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
OPENAI_API_KEY=<YOUR_OPEN_API_KEY>  # If you want to use OpenAI
    ### OR
TOGETHER_API_KEY=<YOUR_TOGETHER_API_KEY>  # If you want to use Together AI
BASE_URL=<YOUR_BASE_URL>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Ollama Local LLM in Xyne
DESCRIPTION: Sets the local Ollama model name in the .env.default file. Requires the model to be downloaded and working on the host machine.
SOURCE: https://github.com/xynehq/xyne/blob/main/docs/apikeys/apikeys.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
OLLAMA_MODEL=<YOUR_OLLAMA_MODEL_NAME> 
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring AWS Credentials for Amazon Bedrock in Xyne
DESCRIPTION: Sets up AWS Access Key, Secret Key, and Region in the .env.default file. The region is optional and defaults to us-west-2 if not specified.
SOURCE: https://github.com/xynehq/xyne/blob/main/docs/apikeys/apikeys.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
AWS_ACCESS_KEY=<YOUR_AWS_ACCESS_KEY> 
AWS_SECRET_KEY=<YOUR_AWS_SECRET_KEY>  
AWS_REGION=<YOUR_AWS_REGION>     
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Google OAuth Scopes
DESCRIPTION: List of OAuth scopes required for accessing various Google services including Drive, Documents, Spreadsheets, Presentations, Contacts, Gmail, and Calendar. These scopes are configured with readonly access to ensure minimal required permissions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/xynehq/xyne/blob/main/docs/authentication/oauth.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.readonly,
https://www.googleapis.com/auth/documents.readonly,
https://www.googleapis.com/auth/spreadsheets.readonly,
https://www.googleapis.com/auth/presentations.readonly,
https://www.googleapis.com/auth/contacts.readonly,
https://www.googleapis.com/auth/contacts.other.readonly,
https://www.googleapis.com/auth/gmail.readonly,
https://www.googleapis.com/auth/calendar.events.readonly,
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Google OAuth API Scopes for Xyne Integration
DESCRIPTION: This snippet lists the Google API scopes required for the OAuth integration. These scopes define the access permissions for reading various Google services including Drive, Documents, Spreadsheets, Presentations, Contacts, Gmail, and Calendar events.
SOURCE: https://github.com/xynehq/xyne/blob/main/docs/ingestion/oauth-ingest.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.readonly,https://www.googleapis.com/auth/documents.readonly,https://www.googleapis.com/auth/spreadsheets.readonly,https://www.googleapis.com/auth/presentations.readonly,https://www.googleapis.com/auth/contacts.readonly,https://www.googleapis.com/auth/contacts.other.readonly,https://www.googleapis.com/auth/gmail.readonly,https://www.googleapis.com/auth/calendar.events.readonly
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Google API OAuth Scopes for Domain-Wide Delegation
DESCRIPTION: This snippet contains the OAuth scopes needed for domain-wide delegation when setting up a service account. These scopes grant read-only access to various Google services like Drive, Docs, Sheets, Gmail, and Calendar.
SOURCE: https://github.com/xynehq/xyne/blob/main/docs/authentication/service-accounts.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.readonly,https://www.googleapis.com/auth/documents.readonly,https://www.googleapis.com/auth/spreadsheets.readonly,https://www.googleapis.com/auth/presentations.readonly,https://www.googleapis.com/auth/contacts.readonly,https://www.googleapis.com/auth/contacts.other.readonly,https://www.googleapis.com/auth/gmail.readonly,https://www.googleapis.com/auth/calendar.events.readonly,https://www.googleapis.com/auth/admin.directory.user.readonly
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Together AI Models in Xyne
DESCRIPTION: Sets up the Together AI API key along with standard and fast model names in the .env.default file.
SOURCE: https://github.com/xynehq/xyne/blob/main/docs/apikeys/apikeys.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
TOGETHER_API_KEY=<YOUR_TOGETHER_API_KEY>
TOGETHER_MODEL=<YOUR_TOGETHER_MODEL>
TOGETHER_FAST_MODEL=<YOUR_TOGETHER_FAST_MODEL>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Enabling Reasoning Capability in Xyne
DESCRIPTION: Adds the REASONING flag to enable reasoning capabilities in compatible models.
SOURCE: https://github.com/xynehq/xyne/blob/main/docs/apikeys/apikeys.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
REASONING=true
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Up Frontend Environment Variables for Production
DESCRIPTION: Environment variables configuration for the frontend to specify API and WebSocket base URLs pointing to the AWS instance DNS.
SOURCE: https://github.com/xynehq/xyne/blob/main/docs/deployment/cloud/aws/aws-deployment-with-docker.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
VITE_API_BASE_URL=http://<YOUR_AWS_INSTANCE_IPv4_DNS>
VITE_WS_BASE_URL=wss://<YOUR_AWS_INSTANCE_IPv4_DNS>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Environment Variables Configuration
DESCRIPTION: Sample environment variables configuration including authentication, API keys, and service configurations
SOURCE: https://github.com/xynehq/xyne/blob/main/docs/contribution/devmode.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
ENCRYPTION_KEY=<YOUR_ENCRYPTION_KEY>
# If you wish to execute authorization using Service Account then use :
 SERVICE_ACCOUNT_ENCRYPTION_KEY=<YOUR_SERVICE_ACCOUNT_ENCRYPTION_KEY> 


GOOGLE_CLIENT_ID=<YOUR_GOOGLE_CLIENT_ID>
GOOGLE_CLIENT_SECRET=<YOUR_GOOGLE_CLIENT_SECRET>
GOOGLE_REDIRECT_URI=http://localhost:3000/v1/auth/callback

HOST=http://localhost:3000

JWT_SECRET=<YOUR_JWT_SECRET>

DATABASE_HOST=xyne-db
VESPA_HOST=vespa


## If using AWS Bedrock
AWS_ACCESS_KEY=<YOUR_AWS_ACCESS_KEY>
AWS_SECRET_KEY=<YOUR_AWS_ACCESS_SECRET>
AWS_REGION=<YOUR_AWS_REGION>
  
## OR [ If using Open AI ]
OPENAI_API_KEY=<YOUR_OPEN_API_KEY>

## OR [ If using Ollama ] 
OLLAMA_MODEL=<YOUR_OLLAMA_MODEL_NAME> 

## OR  [ If using Together AI ] 
TOGETHER_API_KEY=<YOUR_TOGETHER_API_KEY>
TOGETHER_MODEL=<YOUR_TOGETHER_MODEL>
TOGETHER_FAST_MODEL=<YOUR_TOGETHER_FAST_MODEL>

## OR  [ If using Fireworks AI ] 
FIREWORKS_API_KEY=<YOUR_FIREWORKS_API_KEY>
FIREWORKS_MODEL=<YOUR_FIREWORKS_MODEL>
FIREWORKS_FAST_MODEL=<YOUR_FIREWORKS_FAST_MODEL>

## OR [If using Google AI]
GEMINI_API_KEY=<YOUR_GEMINI_API_KEY> 
GEMINI_MODEL=<YOUR_GEMINI_MODEL_NAME>  

## If you are using custom OpenAI or Together AI endpoints
BASE_URL=<YOUR_BASE_URL>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Frontend Environment Configuration
DESCRIPTION: Environment variables configuration for the frontend application including API and WebSocket URLs
SOURCE: https://github.com/xynehq/xyne/blob/main/docs/contribution/devmode.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
VITE_API_BASE_URL=http://localhost:3000
VITE_WS_BASE_URL=ws://localhost:3000
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Docker Compose Deployment Reference
DESCRIPTION: Reference to running Xyne using docker-compose command, mentioned as the primary deployment method for both local and cloud environments.
SOURCE: https://github.com/xynehq/xyne/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: docker
CODE:
```
docker-compose
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Deploying Xyne with Docker Compose
DESCRIPTION: Command to start the Xyne application using Docker Compose. This will pull and build necessary containers defined in the docker-compose.yml file.
SOURCE: https://github.com/xynehq/xyne/blob/main/docs/quickstart.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
docker-compose -f deployment/docker-compose.yml up
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Deploying Xyne with Docker Compose
DESCRIPTION: Command to deploy the Xyne application using Docker Compose with the specified configuration file for self-hosting.
SOURCE: https://github.com/xynehq/xyne/blob/main/docs/deployment/cloud/aws/aws-deployment-with-docker.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
docker-compose -f deployment/docker-compose.selfhost.yml up
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Delete Table Records
DESCRIPTION: Alternative SQL commands to delete records from individual tables
SOURCE: https://github.com/xynehq/xyne/blob/main/docs/re-ingest/reingest.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
delete from oauth_providers where id=;
```

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
delete from connectors where id= ;
```

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
delete from sync_jobs where id= ;
```

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
delete from sync_history where id= ;
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Truncate Tables
DESCRIPTION: SQL command to truncate all relevant tables at once
SOURCE: https://github.com/xynehq/xyne/blob/main/docs/re-ingest/reingest.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
truncate table connectors, oauth_providers, sync_jobs, sync_history;
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Stopping the Docker Compose Deployment
DESCRIPTION: Command to shut down all containers started by Docker Compose for Xyne, releasing all associated resources.
SOURCE: https://github.com/xynehq/xyne/blob/main/docs/quickstart.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
docker-compose -f deployment/docker-compose.yml down
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Feature Update - DeepSeek Integration in Xyne v0.3.0
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows the feature addition of DeepSeek (670B) to work with together and fireworks client, as part of the February 2025 v0.3.0 update.
SOURCE: https://github.com/xynehq/xyne/blob/main/docs/changelog/overview.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
```Feature``` : Added DeepSeek (670B) to work with together, fireworks client
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Feature Update - Ollama Support in Xyne v0.3.0
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows the addition of Ollama support as part of the February 2025 v0.3.0 update.
SOURCE: https://github.com/xynehq/xyne/blob/main/docs/changelog/overview.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
```Feature``` : Add Ollama support
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Docker Compose Development Setup
DESCRIPTION: Command to start Docker containers for Vespa and PostgreSQL in development mode
SOURCE: https://github.com/xynehq/xyne/blob/main/docs/contribution/devmode.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
docker-compose -f deployment/docker-compose.dev.yml up
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Feature Update - Unified Deployment in Xyne v0.2.4
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows the implementation of unified deployment using a single command with docker-compose, as part of the January 2025 v0.2.4 update.
SOURCE: https://github.com/xynehq/xyne/blob/main/docs/changelog/overview.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
```Feature``` : Unified deployment - a single command to run the app using docker-compose
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Starting Metrics Dashboard with Docker Compose
DESCRIPTION: Command to start the metrics dashboard using Docker Compose. This command should be run from the root folder of the project.
SOURCE: https://github.com/xynehq/xyne/blob/main/observability/docs/observability.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
docker-compose -f deployment/docker-compose.metrics.yml up
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: List Database Tables
DESCRIPTION: PostgreSQL command to display all tables in the database
SOURCE: https://github.com/xynehq/xyne/blob/main/docs/re-ingest/reingest.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
\d
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Feature Update - Role-Based UI Checking in Xyne v0.2.4
DESCRIPTION: This snippet documents the addition of role-based checking in the UI for the integrations page as part of the January 2025 v0.2.4 update.
SOURCE: https://github.com/xynehq/xyne/blob/main/docs/changelog/overview.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
```Feature``` : Addition of role based checking in UI for integrations page
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Feature Update - OpenAI Error Mapping Improvement in Xyne v0.3.0
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows the enhancement of OpenAI error mapping to provide better messages, especially for rate limits, in the February 2025 v0.3.0 update.
SOURCE: https://github.com/xynehq/xyne/blob/main/docs/changelog/overview.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
```Feature``` : Improve OpenAI error mapping for better messages especially for rate limits
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Feature Update - Deployment Experience Improvement in Xyne v0.3.0
DESCRIPTION: This snippet documents the enhancement of the deployment experience in the February 2025 v0.3.0 update.
SOURCE: https://github.com/xynehq/xyne/blob/main/docs/changelog/overview.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
```Feature``` : Smoother deployment experience
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Enhancement - Optional AWS Region in Xyne v0.3.0
DESCRIPTION: This snippet documents making the AWS region in environment variables optional as part of the February 2025 v0.3.0 update.
SOURCE: https://github.com/xynehq/xyne/blob/main/docs/changelog/overview.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
```Enhancement``` : Made AWS region in env optional
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Up ESLint with React Plugin in a TypeScript Vite Project
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to integrate the eslint-plugin-react with TypeScript ESLint configuration. It sets the React version, adds the React plugin, and incorporates recommended React ESLint rules including JSX runtime rules.
SOURCE: https://github.com/xynehq/xyne/blob/main/frontend/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
// eslint.config.js
import react from 'eslint-plugin-react'

export default tseslint.config({
  // Set the react version
  settings: { react: { version: '18.3' } },
  plugins: {
    // Add the react plugin
    react,
  },
  rules: {
    // other rules...
    // Enable its recommended rules
    ...react.configs.recommended.rules,
    ...react.configs['jsx-runtime'].rules,
  },
})
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Accessing Docker Container
DESCRIPTION: Command to access the Xyne database Docker container bash shell
SOURCE: https://github.com/xynehq/xyne/blob/main/docs/re-ingest/reingest.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
docker exec -it xyne-db bash
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Feeding Processed Data to Vespa
DESCRIPTION: Command to ingest the processed data into the Vespa search engine running on localhost.
SOURCE: https://github.com/xynehq/xyne/blob/main/server/eval/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
vespa feed -t http://localhost:8080 path/to/processedData.json
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Processing Documents for Vespa
DESCRIPTION: Command to prepare the corpus documents for Vespa ingestion using a TypeScript script with bun runtime.
SOURCE: https://github.com/xynehq/xyne/blob/main/server/eval/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
bun run processDataForVespa.ts --corpus path/to/corpus.jsonl --output path/to/processedData.json
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Evaluation Queries
DESCRIPTION: Command to evaluate the search using queries against the Vespa instance, generating results in TSV format.
SOURCE: https://github.com/xynehq/xyne/blob/main/server/eval/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
bun run evaluate.ts --queries path/to/queries.jsonl --output path/to/output/.tsv
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Cloning the Xyne Repository
DESCRIPTION: Git command to clone the Xyne repository from GitHub to your local machine.
SOURCE: https://github.com/xynehq/xyne/blob/main/docs/quickstart.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
git clone https://github.com/xynehq/xyne.git
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Cloning Xyne Repository
DESCRIPTION: Command to clone the Xyne application repository from GitHub
SOURCE: https://github.com/xynehq/xyne/blob/main/docs/contribution/devmode.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
git clone https://github.com/xynehq/xyne.git
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Cloning the Xyne Repository
DESCRIPTION: Command to clone the Xyne repository from GitHub using git.
SOURCE: https://github.com/xynehq/xyne/blob/main/docs/deployment/cloud/aws/aws-deployment-with-docker.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
git clone https://github.com/xynehq/xyne.git
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Evaluation Metrics
DESCRIPTION: Command to run the Python script that calculates evaluation metrics using pytrec_eval based on qrels and results.
SOURCE: https://github.com/xynehq/xyne/blob/main/server/eval/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_13

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
python trec_eval.py --qrel_file path/to/trec_qrels.tsv --run_file path/to/results/.tsv
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Rebuilding Frontend in Docker Container
DESCRIPTION: Command to execute a rebuild of the frontend application inside the Docker container after setting environment variables.
SOURCE: https://github.com/xynehq/xyne/blob/main/docs/deployment/cloud/aws/aws-deployment-with-docker.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
docker exec -it xyne-app sh -c "cd /usr/src/app/frontend && bun run build"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Copying Environment Variables to Docker Container
DESCRIPTION: Command to copy the production environment variables file to the running Docker container for the frontend application.
SOURCE: https://github.com/xynehq/xyne/blob/main/docs/deployment/cloud/aws/aws-deployment-with-docker.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
docker cp /path/to/your/.env.production xyne-app:usr/src/app/frontend/.env.production
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Downloading SciFact Dataset
DESCRIPTION: Command to download the SciFact dataset from BeIR repository using curl.
SOURCE: https://github.com/xynehq/xyne/blob/main/server/eval/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
cd server/eval && curl -o data/scifact.zip https://public.ukp.informatik.tu-darmstadt.de/thakur/BEIR/datasets/scifact.zip
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Extracting SciFact and NFCorpus Datasets
DESCRIPTION: Command to unzip both SciFact and NFCorpus datasets into the data directory in one step.
SOURCE: https://github.com/xynehq/xyne/blob/main/server/eval/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
unzip data/scifact.zip -d data | unzip data/nfcorpus.zip -d data
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Downloading FiQA Dataset with curl
DESCRIPTION: Alternative command to download the FiQA dataset using curl instead of wget.
SOURCE: https://github.com/xynehq/xyne/blob/main/server/eval/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
cd server/eval && curl -o data/fiqa.zip https://public.ukp.informatik.tu-darmstadt.de/thakur/BEIR/datasets/fiqa.zip
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Converting Query Relevance to TREC Format
DESCRIPTION: Command to convert query relevance (qrels) file into TREC format using a TypeScript script with bun runtime.
SOURCE: https://github.com/xynehq/xyne/blob/main/server/eval/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
bun run qrelsToTrecFormat.ts --file path/to/qrels/.tsv --output path/to/trec_qrels/.tsv
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Downloading FiQA Dataset with wget
DESCRIPTION: Command to download the FiQA (Financial Question Answering) dataset from BeIR repository using wget and place it in the data directory.
SOURCE: https://github.com/xynehq/xyne/blob/main/server/eval/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
cd server/eval && wget https://public.ukp.informatik.tu-darmstadt.de/thakur/BEIR/datasets/fiqa.zip -P  data
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Mintlify Documentation Locally with Bun
DESCRIPTION: Command to run the Xyne project documentation locally using Mintlify dev server with Bun package manager. This allows developers to preview documentation changes before deployment.
SOURCE: https://github.com/xynehq/xyne/blob/main/docs/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
bunx mintlify dev
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing pytrec_eval Package
DESCRIPTION: Command to install the pytrec_eval Python package for computing evaluation metrics.
SOURCE: https://github.com/xynehq/xyne/blob/main/server/eval/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_12

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
uv pip install pytrec_eval
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Datasets Package for NanoBeir
DESCRIPTION: Command to install the datasets Python package needed for NanoBeir evaluation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/xynehq/xyne/blob/main/server/eval/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_14

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
uv pip install datasets
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Downloading NanoBeir Datasets
DESCRIPTION: Command to run the Python script that downloads all NanoBeir datasets for evaluation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/xynehq/xyne/blob/main/server/eval/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_15

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
python getNanoBeir.py
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring ESLint Parser Options for TypeScript Projects in Vite
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to configure the ESLint parser options for TypeScript projects. It sets up the project files to be analyzed and specifies the root directory using import.meta.dirname.
SOURCE: https://github.com/xynehq/xyne/blob/main/frontend/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
export default tseslint.config({
  languageOptions: {
    // other options...
    parserOptions: {
      project: ['./tsconfig.node.json', './tsconfig.app.json'],
      tsconfigRootDir: import.meta.dirname,
    },
  },
})
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Script Permission Setup
DESCRIPTION: Commands to set executable permissions for the initialization script on different operating systems
SOURCE: https://github.com/xynehq/xyne/blob/main/docs/contribution/devmode.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
sudo chmod +x init-script.sh [ For Mac OS and Unix ]

OR 

icacls init-script.sh /grant Everyone:F [If using PowerShell in Windows]
```

TITLE: PostgreSQL User Login
DESCRIPTION: Command to login to PostgreSQL database as Xyne user
SOURCE: https://github.com/xynehq/xyne/blob/main/docs/re-ingest/reingest.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_1


TITLE: View Table Contents
DESCRIPTION: SQL queries to view contents of various tables in the database
SOURCE: https://github.com/xynehq/xyne/blob/main/docs/re-ingest/reingest.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
select * from oauth_providers;
```

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
select * from connectors;
```

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
select * from sync_jobs;
```

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
select * from sync_history;
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
source .venv/bin/activate
```

TITLE: Displaying Xyne Logo Images for Light and Dark Modes in HTML
DESCRIPTION: This HTML snippet displays two images of the Xyne logo, one for light mode and one for dark mode. It uses CSS classes to control visibility based on the user's theme preference.
SOURCE: https://github.com/xynehq/xyne/blob/main/docs/introduction.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: HTML
CODE:
```
<img
  className="block dark:hidden"
  src="/images/intro.png"
  alt="Xyne light"
/>
<img
  className="hidden dark:block"
  src="/images/intro.png"
  alt="Xyne dark"
/>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Exit Container
DESCRIPTION: Command to exit from the PostgreSQL prompt and Docker container
SOURCE: https://github.com/xynehq/xyne/blob/main/docs/re-ingest/reingest.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
exit
```
